data.title: Technology Alliance Partners — Logitel
data.text:
Microsoft Corporation, founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen in 1975, is a global technology leader renowned for its software, services, devices, and solutions. Headquartered in Redmond, Washington, it’s best known for its Windows operating systems and Office productivity suite. Microsoft enables digital transformation for the era of an intelligent cloud and an intelligent edge. Its mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more

Zoom, is a leading communications technology company founded by Eric Yuan in 2011. It gained prominence for its easy-to-use video conferencing software, which became especially popular during the COVID-19 pandemic as a vital tool for remote work, education, and personal connections. Based in San Jose, California, Zoom offers video and audio conferencing, chat, webinars, and collaboration capabilities across devices and platforms. Its intuitive interface and reliable performance have made it a preferred choice for businesses and individuals alike

HP is well-regarded for its wide range of printers, laptops, desktops, and related supplies. Poly, formerly Plantronics and Polycom, is a renowned manufacturer of audio and video conferencing solutions, known for its headsets, video, and voice conference technology. In 2021, HP announced the acquisition of Poly, aiming to enhance its hybrid work solutions by integrating Poly’s expertise in video and audio equipment, furthering HP’s commitment to providing advanced technology for flexible work environments.

Neat was founded in Oslo, Norway, at the beginning of 2019 by a team of creative mavericks who, for decades, shaped game-changing innovations for some of the world’s most recognized video communications brands. Designing engaging experiences that allow you to meet, create and collaborate whenever, wherever and however you want, Neat devices natively support Microsoft Teams, Zoom and a range of compelling business applications.

AudioCodes was founded in 1993 and headquartered in Israel, AudioCodes serves a significant role in the telecommunications industry by enabling enterprises and service providers to build and operate all-IP voice networks for unified communications, contact centers, and hosted business services. The company offers a broad range of products including session border controllers, VoIP gateways, routers, and IP phones. AudioCodes is recognized for its innovation and commitment to providing superior voice quality and network reliability.

Sippio is the world’s leading voice enablement platform, the easiest and fastest way for resellers and carriers to bring PSTN calling into Microsoft Teams and Zoom Phone. Available in over 70 countries, organizations across the globe rely on SIPPIO to keep their people connected. With flexible subscription plans, SIPPIO deploys in minutes and ensures a reliable, secure, compliant, and redundant voice solution.

CodeTwo is an independent software vendor recognized as Microsoft Partner of the Year Customer Experience Award Finalist and Microsoft Partner of the Year ISV Winner. Our solutions for Microsoft 365, Office 365 and Exchange are delivered to over 110,000 organizations from 170+ countries, including companies such as Facebook, Samsung, Volkswagen, UNICEF and many of the Fortune 500 companies.

Barco is a global technology company headquartered in Kortrijk, Belgium, founded in 1934. Barco’s products are designed to enhance productivity and improve the effectiveness of shared content in professional environments. The company’s innovative technologies are used in control rooms, conference rooms, healthcare institutions, and entertainment venues around the world. With a focus on developing high-quality, user-centric, and sustainable solutions, Barco is committed to empowering professionals across industries to achieve better outcomes through superior visualization.

Founded in 2013, Huddly is headquartered in Oslo, Norway, with presence in the US and EMEA and distribution globally. Huddly cameras are designed to provide high-quality, AI-powered video meetings on major platforms, including Microsoft Teams, Zoom, and Google Meet. With upgradable software, durable hardware, and engaging user experiences, they are the ideal choice for organizations seeking a future-proof, scalable, and sustainable solution.

Yealink is a global-leading provider of Unified Communication & Collaboration Solutions specialized in video conferencing, voice communications, and collaboration, dedicated to helping every person and organization embrace the power of “Easy Collaboration, High Productivity”. With best-in-class quality, innovative technology, and user-friendly experiences, Yealink is one of the best providers in more than 140 countries and regions, ranks No.1 in the global market share of IP Phones, and is the Top 5 leader in the video conferencing market (Frost & Sullivan, 2021).

Ribbon Communications is a global provider of real-time communications software and network solutions to service providers, enterprises, and critical infrastructure sectors. Founded in 1997 and headquartered in Plano, Texas, Ribbon offers a comprehensive suite of products and services that includes secure and scalable session border controllers, IP multimedia subsystems, voice over IP (VoIP) solutions, and cloud-native communications platforms. The company focuses on facilitating secure and intelligent cloud communications, with an emphasis on modernizing voice and data networks for the digital age.

Shure Incorporated is a renowned American audio products company founded in 1925. It specializes in manufacturing high-quality microphones, wireless microphone systems, in-ear monitors, earphones, and headphones, as well as audio processing and conferencing equipment. Headquartered in Niles, Illinois, Shure has built a reputation for innovation and durability in audio technology, catering to both professionals and consumers globally. The brand is particularly esteemed in the music industry for its exceptional sound quality and reliability.

QSC, LLC is a leading manufacturer of professional audio/video equipment, based in Costa Mesa, California. Founded in 1968, the company initially focused on power amplifiers but has since expanded to include loudspeakers, digital mixers, and networked audio solutions for a variety of applications, including live sound, installed sound systems, and cinema. QSC is widely recognized for its innovative products that combine reliability with high-performance sound quality. QSC also provides comprehensive software and services that enable audio professionals to create customized solutions for their unique sound environments.

Extron is a leading developer and manufacturer of professional AV (audiovisual) system integration products, including computer-video interfaces, switchers, matrix switchers, distribution amplifiers, and signal conditioning equipment. Founded in 1983 and headquartered in Anaheim, California, Extron is known for its broad range of solutions that serve the educational, government, corporate, and healthcare markets.

Logitech designs products and experiences that have an everyday place in people’s lives. Logitech helps all people pursue their passions by designing experiences so everyone can create, achieve, and enjoy more. Logitech designs and creates products that bring people together through computing, gaming, video, streaming and creating, and music.

Jabra is a globally recognized leader in audio and communications technology. Founded in 1983 and based in Copenhagen, Denmark, Jabra is a subsidiary of GN Group, which has a legacy that dates back to 1869. Jabra specializes in producing a wide range of audio solutions, from high-quality headsets for both consumer and business use to innovative speakerphones and video conferencing solutions. Known for its commitment to sound excellence, Jabra integrates advanced noise-cancellation technologies and ergonomic design to enhance user experience, whether for music, calls, or work.
